maml:description.maml:para: Create a connection to PSADO, using a PAT
This function sets up a connection to Azure DevOps to test the credentials. If they are correct, the token and username are stored in the current session.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. so https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. so https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stores User- and Token-variable in the session so they only have to be provided once.

maml:description.maml:para: Get information about Builds within a project in Azure DevOps
List Azure DevOps Builds that belong to a project. You can list them all, or select builds based on Buildnumbers or the source repository

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Project to search within. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The number of the build that is needed
The Name of the source repository that is configured to use the build
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
The name of the Project to search within. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The number of the build that is needed
The Name of the source repository that is configured to use the build
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows all builds for the project Project01 in the Organization Company
Get-PSADOBuild -Organization Company -Project Project01 -Repository Repo01
Returns all builds that have been queued for repository Repo01

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of Build Definitions and their properties
List Azure DevOps Builds Definitions that belong to a project. You can list them all, or select builds based on Builnumber or BuildDefinitionID

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Project to search within. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The Name of the BuildDefinition
The ID for the Build Definition
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
The name of the Project to search within. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The Name of the BuildDefinition
The ID for the Build Definition
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows all build definitions for the project Project01 in the Organization Company
Get-PSADOBuild -Organization Company -Project Project01 -BuildDefinitionName Build01
Returns the build definition Build01

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of projects or a single project in Azure DevOps
List Azure DevOps Projects If a Projectname is provided, details about that project will be returned

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Project to search for. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
The name of the Project to search for. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists all the projects within the organization
Get-PSADOProject -Organization Company -Project Project01
Returns the properties of the Project named Project01

maml:description.maml:para: Get information about Releases within a project in Azure DevOps
List Azure DevOps Releases that belong to a project. You can list them all, or select builds based on Buildnumbers or the source repository

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Project to search within. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The number of the Release that is needed
The Definition that the release is based on.
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

The number of the Release that is needed

The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows all Releases for the project Project01 in the Organization Company
Get-PSADORelease -Organization Company -Project Project01 -ReleaseDefinition Rep01-CD
Returns all releases that have been pushed for the definition Rep01-CD

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of Release Definitions and their properties
List Azure DevOps Release Definitions that belong to a project. You can list them all, or select Releases based on Releasenumber or ReleaseDefinitionID

The Name of the ReleaseDefinition

A username, with format user@Company.com

Get-PSADORelease -Organization Company -Project Project01 -ReleaseDefinitionName Release01

maml:description.maml:para: Trigger an Azure DevOps build
Trigger a build to run by defining the builddefinitionName. After this command has run the build of the pipeline will be queued

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Project the build is in. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The name of the build definition that needs to get a new build queued
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
The name of the Project the build is in. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
The name of the build definition that needs to get a new build queued
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will trigger the builddefinition Rep-CI to create a new build

maml:description.maml:para: Trigger an Azure DevOps Release
Trigger a Release to run by defining the ReleasedefinitionName. After this command has run the release of the pipeline will be queued

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Project the release is in. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
{{Fill ReleaseDefinitionName Description}}
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
The name of the Project the release is in. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}/{Project}
{{Fill ReleaseDefinitionName Description}}
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will trigger the Releasedefinition Rep-CI to create a new Release

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Project in Azure DevOps
This function creates a new project. You need to provide a projectName and organizationname other parameters will get default values. Function will keep track of status till project is created.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the New project that needs to be created.
A description for the project, will be visible in Azure DevOps. Can be left empty
Select the SourceControltype, GIT or Tfvc. GIT is default.
Select if Templatetype should be Agile, Scrum or CMMI
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the New project that needs to be created.
A description for the project, will be visible in Azure DevOps. Can be left empty
Select the SourceControltype, GIT or Tfvc. GIT is default.
Select if Templatetype should be Agile, Scrum or CMMI
The name of the Companyaccount in Azure DevOps. So https://dev.azure.com/{Organization}
A username, with format user@Company.com
the PAT for the connection. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Barbara Forbes Module: Psado https://4bes.nl @Ba4bes

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-PSADOProject -Organization Company -Project test -Description "this is a project"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a project called test in the organization Company, with description "this is a project"
